### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

events.message:
[refactor] combine block vtx loops in BlockConnected

Now that m_txrequest and m_recent_confirmed_transactions are guarded by
the same mutex, there is no benefit to processing them separately.
Instead, just loop through pblock->vtx once.

events.body:
lgtm ACK 1b732dbc3bd9c59303a774cf2095c2d6639dbe1d
(happy to re-ACK if the [`Assert` suggestion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30507#discussion_r1689880324) for `pindexNewTip` is taken)

events.message: [refactor] change ActiveTipChange to use CBlockIndex ref instead of ptr

m_tx_download_mutex followups

- add AssertLockNotHeld(m_tx_download_mutex) in net_processing
- move doc about m_tx_download_mutex and mempool mutex to ActiveTipChange

comments.body: style nit: Indenting the body of the new scope would be nice

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2072,6 +2070,8 @@ void PeerManagerImpl::StartScheduledTasks(CScheduler& scheduler)
 
 void PeerManagerImpl::ActiveTipChange(const CBlockIndex* new_tip, bool is_ibd)
 {
+    // Ensure mempool mutex was released, otherwise deadlock may occur if another thread holding
+    // m_tx_download_mutex waits on the mempool mutex.
comments.body: note to myself: See if `ACQUIRED_BEFORE` helps here at compile time

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2072,6 +2070,8 @@ void PeerManagerImpl::StartScheduledTasks(CScheduler& scheduler)
 
 void PeerManagerImpl::ActiveTipChange(const CBlockIndex* new_tip, bool is_ibd)
 {
+    // Ensure mempool mutex was released, otherwise deadlock may occur if another thread holding
+    // m_tx_download_mutex waits on the mempool mutex.
comments.body: Hm, added a `ACQUIRED_BEFORE`, but compiler didn't complain when I added a `LOCK2(m_mempool.cs, m_tx_download_mutex)`
aside: we could throw an ~`Assume()`~ `Assert()` on the pointer before deref, since it's not set in a non-trivial way above
(If you're gonna do this) `Assert` would make more sense, since we'd never want to hit the deref if it fails
